items.q: Who composed the iconic musical scores for films like 'Star Wars', 'Jaws', and 'Indiana Jones'?
items.explanation: He is widely regarded as one of the greatest film composers in history.

items.q: The Hollywood Walk of Fame allows anyone to buy a star if they have enough money.
items.explanation: Nominees must be selected by a committee, though there is a large sponsorship fee afterward.

items.q: The video game industry currently generates more revenue globally than the film and music industries combined.
items.explanation: Video games have grown into the largest and most lucrative entertainment sector.

items.q: What hugely successful AMC television series followed survivors during a zombie apocalypse?
items.explanation: Based on a comic book, it became one of the most-watched cable shows in history.

items.q: What ongoing reality competition follows entrepreneurs pitching ideas to a panel of wealthy investors?
items.explanation: The popular show has launched hundreds of successful modern businesses.

items.q: What iconic 1990s dance craze was created by Spanish duo Los Del Rio?
items.explanation: The song and accompanying dance became a massive worldwide phenomenon in 1996.

items.q: Which actor starred as Walter White in the critically acclaimed series 'Breaking Bad'?
items.explanation: His performance won multiple Emmy Awards for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series.

items.q: What highly influential sketch comedy show launched the careers of comedians like Eddie Murphy and Mike Myers?
items.explanation: The show has been a launchpad for comedic talent since its debut in 1975.

items.q: Which animated movie studio released 'Shrek' as a direct competitor to Disney/Pixar's dominance?
items.explanation: The film parodied classic fairy tales and established DreamWorks as a major animation powerhouse.

items.q: What was the name of the popular music video channel that revolutionized the music industry in the 1980s?
items.explanation: Its debut profoundly changed how artists marketed their music.
